meanings.sent1: The fog dislimns the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent2: Her tears dislimns the words on the page.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell dislimns reality, making everything hazy.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to dislimns the memories, fading them into a blur.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes dislimns the boundaries between colors, creating a dreamy effect.

meanings.definition: To cause to lose clarity or definition.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain dislimns the outlines of the buildings.
meanings.sent2: The poor lighting dislimns the details of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child loves to dislimns his sister's carefully drawn lines.
meanings.sent4: The noise of the city dislimns the peacefulness of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The passing years dislimns the once sharp features, softening them with age.
